instruction: Can you help me write a resignation letter to my current employer, while leaving on good terms and expressing gratitude for the opportunities provided?
output:
Narrator: Of course! Here's a sample resignation letter that you can use as a template:
Dear [Name of Supervisor],
I am writing to inform you that I have decided to resign from my position at [Company Name].
I would like to take this opportunity to express my sincere gratitude for the opportunities and experiences I have had during my time here. I have learned so much from the talented and dedicated individuals I have worked with, and I will carry these lessons with me as I embark on my next chapter.
I would also like to thank you for your guidance and support throughout my time here. Your leadership and mentorship have been invaluable, and I will always cherish the skills and knowledge I have gained under your guidance.
Once again, thank you for everything.
Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,
[Your Name]
